chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Hailie K. Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed.

No bars, liquor stores, beer tents, or taverns.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hailie K. Gomez

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

4:10 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Kat Yanke for Attorney Heather Roehr.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 2: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability), Repeater >>

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; No bars, liquor stores, beer tents, or taverns; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; and 3 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 4:25p.m.
